content.webTitle: Athletics: Beirut race may go ahead

fields.headline: Beirut race may go ahead
fields.bodyText: The marathon is one of sport's toughest challenges so imagine how hardy the 25,000 runners taking part in the Beirut Marathon on November 26 must be. Even as recently as last week, with a naval blockade still in place and residual skirmishes on the Lebanon-Israel frontier, it seemed highly unlikely that the race would go ahead. "Only a short section of the marathon course, through Dahyeh, is in ruins," said Mark Dickinson, the race director. "And the government has promised that the roads will be cleaned and fixed by November."
